SENT.plain: Cerebral sinus thrombosis is a rare cause of spontaneous subarachnoid hemorrhage
The development of cerebral sinus thrombosis as a complication of heparin-induced thrombocytopenia is even rarer
In this paper, we present a 59-year-old patient admitted to our service with cerebral sinus thrombosis secondary to type II heparin-induced thrombocytopenia
We also review the literature in regard to the incidence, pathophysiology and management of this rare clinicopathological entity
